TextLibrary.Text: We're so grateful for the help, lad. My good friend Thallis, a blacksmith here in Dhun-Kor, lost a family heirloom in one o' the wagons that was on its way to Dhun-Kor. A little silver key it is, belonged to his granpappy, given to him by the King o' Lysea back in the day when...

We're so grateful for the help, lad. My good friend Thallis, a blacksmith here in Dhun-Kor, lost a family heirloom in one o' the wagons that was on its way to Dhun-Kor. A little silver key it is, belonged to his granpappy, given to him by the King o' Lysea back in the day when...

We're so grateful for the help, lass. My good friend Thallis, a blacksmith here in Dhun-Kor, lost a family heirloom in one o' the wagons that was on its way to Dhun-Kor. A little silver key it is, belonged to his granpappy, given to him by the King o' Lysea back in the day when...

We're so grateful for the help, lass. My good friend Thallis, a blacksmith here in Dhun-Kor, lost a family heirloom in one o' the wagons that was on its way to Dhun-Kor. A little silver key it is, belonged to his granpappy, given to him by the King o' Lysea back in the day when...
A silver key, Khalkus, that's all I really need to know.
A silver key, Khalkus, that's all I really need to know.
A silver key, Khalkus, that's all I really need to know.
A silver key, Khalkus, that's all I really need to know.

Oh aye. And I reckon it's been taken to the Ogre's Tower near the Hammer Pass. I once had an idea that if ye built a tunnel, starting a fair way back though, ye could get into that tower without fightin' the Ogres. And I can only imagine what they've...

Enough! If we don't stop talking, we'll never find the key.
Enough! If we don't stop talking, we'll never find the key.
